meanings.definition: The triangular bone at the base of the spine.
meanings.sent1: Doctors study the sacrums to understand back injuries.
meanings.sent2: The sacrum is an important part of the spine.
meanings.sent3: The sacrums in our bodies help us stand tall.
meanings.sent4: Her strong posture was like a pillar supported by sacrums.
meanings.sent5: The sacrum is like a sturdy foundation for the spine.

meanings.sent1: The X-ray showed multiple sacrums in the patient's spine.
meanings.sent2: The doctor pointed out the sacrums on the scan.
meanings.sent3: The museum displayed ancient sacrums from different species.
meanings.sent4: In the anatomy class, students examined various sacrums.
meanings.sent5: The sacrums lined up neatly in the medical textbook.
